intro: Rosa brevistyla var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular-stemmed shrub rose, is a variant of the shrub rose species native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems that are covered in glandular dots, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, with serrated leaflets that contribute to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for garden cultivation.
